attributes.action: If deficit exceeds 3% percent of GDP, MPs become ineligible for re-election.
attributes.additional_details:
Our national debt is out of control. 

In 2024–25, the UK government is expected to spend 7.3% of its total public spending purely on debt interest. 

In 2023/24, government revenue – from taxes and other receipts – was £1,098 bn while government spending was £1,230 bn. The deficit was therefore £131 bn, equivalent to 4.8% of GDP.

At 4.8% of GDP, the deficit was the UK’s seventeenth largest in the 76 years since 1948.

We need those in power to be held to account, not career politicians.
attributes.background: If there is a spending deficit of more than 3%, in efforts to curb national borrowing, do not allow sitting Government ministers the ability to re-run as an MP for the remainder of their lifetime.

departments.name: Office of the Leader of the House of Commons

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.
 
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The annual budget deficit is already over 3%, and has been since 2020-21. So we are unsure if you if you would like the petition to apply where the deficit rises above 3% while Ministers are in office, or where they do not bring the deficit under 3%. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
